title: How to Make Hot Chocolate Brownies

steps.headline: Preheat your oven to 350°F (177°C).
steps.description: Line a 9 by 13-inch (22.86 by 33.02-centimeter) baking pan with aluminum foil. Leave a few inches hanging over the edges so that you can remove it later. Lightly grease the foil with cooking spray.

steps.headline: Mix the butter, sugar, eggs, and vanilla extract.
steps.description: If you have not yet done so, melt the butter in the microwave or in a small saucepan over the stove. Pour it into a medium-sized mixing bowl, then add the sugar, eggs, and vanilla extract. Stir everything together with a whisk until the color is consistent and no streaks of egg yolk remain.

steps.headline: Add in the flour, hot chocolate mix, salt, and baking powder.
steps.description: Stir everything together once more until just combined. Be sure to scrape the bottom and sides of the bowl often so that everything mixes evenly. Be careful not to over-mix, or the brownies will turn out tough. Make sure that you use plain hot chocolate mix, and not the kind that has powdered milk already added to it. Give it a Mexican twist by adding 2 teaspoons of ground cinnamon, 1 teaspoon of ground nutmeg, 1 teaspoon of ground ginger, and ½ teaspoon of ground cayenne.

steps.headline: Add in 6 ounces (175 grams) of chocolate chips, if desired.
steps.description: You don't have to  do this, but it will give the brownies some extra texture and chocolately-goodness. Again, be sure to scrape the bottom and sides of the bowl often.

steps.headline: Spread the mixture across the bottom of the pan.
steps.description: Scrape the bowl clean with a rubber spatula so that you don't waste any batter.

steps.headline: Bake the brownies for 30 to 35 minutes.
steps.description: They are ready when they pull away from the sides of the pan and are set in the center.

steps.headline: Spread 6 ounces (175 grams) of chocolate chips over the brownies.
steps.description: Do this immediately after taking the brownies out of the oven. The heat of the brownies will cause the chocolate chips to soften and melt.

steps.headline: Wait 5 minutes before spreading the chocolate chips around.
steps.description: After about 5 minutes, the chocolate chips will have softened enough to be spreadable. Use a  rubber spatula to spread them over the top of the brownie. The chocolate chips may still hold their shape after 5 minutes, but they should be soft enough to spread.

steps.headline: Let the brownies cool.
steps.description: Leave them in the pan for about 10 minutes first. Then, use the aluminum foil to lift them out of the pan. Transfer them to a wire cooling rack and let them finish cooling.

steps.headline: Serve, garnish, and serve the brownies.
steps.description: Cut the brownies into 24 squares using a sharp knife. Top each square with three mini marshmallows foe the final touch.

steps.headline: Mix the hot chocolate mix and flour in a large mug.
steps.description: Pour the hot chocolate mix and the flour into a 16-ounce (475-milliliter) mug. Stir the two together with a fork or mini whisk. You are using a large mug because the brownie needs room to rise as it cooks. This recipe makes enough to serve 1 to 2 people. You can eat the brownie straight from the mug. If you'd rather serve it on a plate, lightly grease the inside of the mug first.

steps.headline: Stir in the water and butter.
steps.description: Melt the butter ahead of time in the microwave or in a little saucepan over the stove. If you don't have any butter, you can use oil instead.

steps.headline: Consider adding some flavor.
steps.description: Hot chocolate mix is already very sweet, but you can give your brownies extra flavor with ½ teaspoon of vanilla extract. Peppermint extract would also taste delightful. Be sure to stir it in well!

steps.headline: Top it off with mini marshmallows.
steps.description: What's hot chocolate without marshmallows? The microwave will help melt marshmallows. If you don't have any marshmallows, or if you don't like them, you can skip this step.

steps.headline: Cook the brownie in the microwave.
steps.description: Set your microwave to HIGH, then cook the brownie for 60 to 90 seconds. The brownie will rise as it cooks, but then it will deflate slightly once you stop the microwave. Do not overcook the brownie, however; you want it to be gooey in the center. Place a paper towel or paper plate under the mug to catch any drips in case the brownie overflows.

steps.headline: Garnish the brownie before serving it, if desired.
steps.description: If you did not add any marshmallows, consider garnishing your brownie with other popular hot chocolate toppings. A swirl of whipped cream and a sprinkle of crushed candy cane would taste delicious! If you greased the inside of the mug, turn the brownie out onto a plate first, then garnish it.

text: Making Basic Hot Chocolate Brownies Preheat your oven to 350°F (177°C). Line a 9 by 13-inch (22.86 by 33.02-centimeter) baking pan with aluminum foil. Leave a few inches hanging over the edges so that you can remove it later. Lightly grease the foil with cooking spray. Mix the butter, sugar, eggs, and vanilla extract. If you have not yet done so, melt the butter in the microwave or in a small saucepan over the stove. Pour it into a medium-sized mixing bowl, then add the sugar, eggs, and vanilla extract. Stir everything together with a whisk until the color is consistent and no streaks of egg yolk remain. Add in the flour, hot chocolate mix, salt, and baking powder. Stir everything together once more until just combined. Be sure to scrape the bottom and sides of the bowl often so that everything mixes evenly. Be careful not to over-mix, or the brownies will turn out tough. Make sure that you use plain hot chocolate mix, and not the kind that has powdered milk already added to it. Give it a Mexican twist by adding 2 teaspoons of ground cinnamon, 1 teaspoon of ground nutmeg, 1 teaspoon of ground ginger, and ½ teaspoon of ground cayenne. Add in 6 ounces (175 grams) of chocolate chips, if desired. You don't have to  do this, but it will give the brownies some extra texture and chocolately-goodness. Again, be sure to scrape the bottom and sides of the bowl often. Spread the mixture across the bottom of the pan. Scrape the bowl clean with a rubber spatula so that you don't waste any batter. Bake the brownies for 30 to 35 minutes. They are ready when they pull away from the sides of the pan and are set in the center. Spread 6 ounces (175 grams) of chocolate chips over the brownies. Do this immediately after taking the brownies out of the oven. The heat of the brownies will cause the chocolate chips to soften and melt. Wait 5 minutes before spreading the chocolate chips around. After about 5 minutes, the chocolate chips will have softened enough to be spreadable. Use a  rubber spatula to spread them over the top of the brownie. The chocolate chips may still hold their shape after 5 minutes, but they should be soft enough to spread. Let the brownies cool. Leave them in the pan for about 10 minutes first. Then, use the aluminum foil to lift them out of the pan. Transfer them to a wire cooling rack and let them finish cooling. Serve, garnish, and serve the brownies. Cut the brownies into 24 squares using a sharp knife. Top each square with three mini marshmallows foe the final touch. Making Hot Chocolate Mug Brownies Mix the hot chocolate mix and flour in a large mug. Pour the hot chocolate mix and the flour into a 16-ounce (475-milliliter) mug. Stir the two together with a fork or mini whisk. You are using a large mug because the brownie needs room to rise as it cooks. This recipe makes enough to serve 1 to 2 people. You can eat the brownie straight from the mug. If you'd rather serve it on a plate, lightly grease the inside of the mug first. Stir in the water and butter. Melt the butter ahead of time in the microwave or in a little saucepan over the stove. If you don't have any butter, you can use oil instead. Consider adding some flavor. Hot chocolate mix is already very sweet, but you can give your brownies extra flavor with ½ teaspoon of vanilla extract. Peppermint extract would also taste delightful. Be sure to stir it in well! Top it off with mini marshmallows. What's hot chocolate without marshmallows? The microwave will help melt marshmallows. If you don't have any marshmallows, or if you don't like them, you can skip this step. Cook the brownie in the microwave. Set your microwave to HIGH, then cook the brownie for 60 to 90 seconds. The brownie will rise as it cooks, but then it will deflate slightly once you stop the microwave. Do not overcook the brownie, however; you want it to be gooey in the center. Place a paper towel or paper plate under the mug to catch any drips in case the brownie overflows. Garnish the brownie before serving it, if desired. If you did not add any marshmallows, consider garnishing your brownie with other popular hot chocolate toppings. A swirl of whipped cream and a sprinkle of crushed candy cane would taste delicious! If you greased the inside of the mug, turn the brownie out onto a plate first, then garnish it.
